verses.text: And it came to pass \add after\add* many days, that the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came to Elijah in the third year, saying, Go, shew thyself unto Ahab; and I will send rain upon the earth.
And Elijah went to shew himself unto Ahab. And \add there was\add* a sore famine in Samaria.
And Ahab called Obadiah, which \add was\add* the governor of \add his\add* house. (Now Obadiah feared the \sc Lord\sc* greatly:

for it was \add so\add*, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the \sc Lord\sc*, that Obadiah took an hundred prophets, and hid them \add by\add* fifty in a cave, and fed them \add with\add* bread and water.)
And Ahab said unto Obadiah, Go into the land, unto all fountains of water, and unto all brooks: peradventure we may find grass to save the horses and mules alive, that we leese not all the beasts.
So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, \add Art\add* thou that my lord Elijah?
And he answered him, I \add am:\add* go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah \add is here\add*.
And he said, What have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me?

\add As\add* the \sc Lord\sc* thy God liveth, there is no nation or kingdom, whither my lord hath not sent to seek thee: and when they said, \add He is\add* not \add there;\add* he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they found thee not.
And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah \add is here\add*.

And it shall come to pass, \add as soon as\add* I am gone from thee, that the spirit of the \sc Lord\sc* shall carry thee whither I know not; and \add so\add* when I come and tell Ahab, and he cannot find thee, he shall slay me: but \add I\add* thy servant fear the \sc Lord\sc* from my youth.

Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of the \sc Lord\sc*, how I hid an hundred men of the \sc Lord’s\sc* prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them \add with\add* bread and water?
And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah \add is here:\add* and he shall slay me.
And Elijah said, \add As\add* the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, I will surely shew myself unto him to day.
So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him: and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said unto him, \add Art\add* thou he that troubleth Israel?
And he answered, I have not troubled Israel; but thou, and thy father’s house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc*, and thou hast followed Baalim.

Now therefore send, \add and\add* gather to me all Israel unto mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty, and the prophets of the groves four hundred, which eat \add at\add* Jezebel’s table.
So Ahab sent unto all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together unto mount Carmel.

And Elijah came unto all the people, and said, How long halt ye between two opinions? if the \sc Lord\sc* \add be\add* God, follow him: but if Baal, \add then\add* follow him. And the people answered him not a word.
Then said Elijah unto the people, I, \add even\add* I only, remain a prophet of the \sc Lord\sc*; but Baal’s prophets \add are\add* four hundred and fifty men.

Let them therefore give us two bullocks; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay \add it\add* on wood, and put no fire \add under:\add* and I will dress the other bullock, and lay \add it\add* on wood, and put no fire \add under:\add*
and call ye on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the \sc Lord\sc*: and the God that answereth by fire, let him be God. And all the people answered and said, It is well spoken.

And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress \add it\add* first; for ye \add are\add* many; and call on the name of your gods, but put no fire \add under\add*.

And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed \add it\add*, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us. But \add there was\add* no voice, nor any that answered. And they leapt upon the altar which was made.

And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, Cry aloud: for he \add is\add* a god; either he is talking, or he is pursuing, or he is in a journey, \add or\add* peradventure he sleepeth, and must be awaked.
And they cried loud, and cut themselves after their manner with knives and lancets, till the blood gushed out upon them.

And it came to pass, when midday was past, and they prophesied until \add the time\add* of the offering of the \add evening\add* sacrifice, that \add there was\add* neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded.
And Elijah said unto all the people, Come near unto me. And all the people came near unto him. And he repaired the altar of the \sc Lord\sc* that was broken down.
And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, unto whom the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came, saying, Israel shall be thy name:
and \add with\add* the stones he built an altar in the name of the \sc Lord\sc*: and he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed.

And he put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid \add him\add* on the wood, and said, Fill four barrels \add with\add* water, and pour \add it\add* on the burnt sacrifice, and on the wood.
And he said, Do \add it\add* the second time. And they did \add it\add* the second time. And he said, Do \add it\add* the third time. And they did \add it\add* the third time.
And the water ran round about the altar; and he filled the trench also \add with\add* water.

And it came to pass at \add the time of\add* the offering of the \add evening\add* sacrifice, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, \sc Lord\sc* God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known \add this\add* day that thou \add art\add* God in Israel, and \add that\add* I \add am\add* thy servant, and \add that\add* I have done all these things at thy word.
Hear me, O \sc Lord\sc*, hear me, that this people may know that thou \add art\add* the \sc Lord\sc* God, and \add that\add* thou hast turned their heart back again.
Then the fire of the \sc Lord\sc* fell, and consumed the burnt sacrifice, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that \add was\add* in the trench.
And when all the people saw \add it\add*, they fell on their faces: and they said, The \sc Lord\sc*, he \add is\add* the God; the \sc Lord\sc*, he \add is\add* the God.
And Elijah said unto them, Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape. And they took them: and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there.
And Elijah said unto Ahab, Get thee up, eat and drink; for \add there is\add* a sound of abundance of rain.
So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he cast himself down upon the earth, and put his face between his knees,
and said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up, and looked, and said, \add There is\add* nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.

And it came to pass at the seventh \add time\add*, that he said, Behold, there ariseth a little cloud out of the sea, like a man’s hand. And he said, Go up, say unto Ahab, Prepare \add thy chariot\add*, and get thee down, that the rain stop thee not.
And it came to pass in the mean while, that the heaven was black \add with\add* clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.
And the hand of the \sc Lord\sc* was on Elijah; and he girded up his loins, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
